task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 187°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the roofline and base of the south-facing building to estimate its total height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The view is now facing north and not the target south-facing building, so I should rotate to look back south (180°) while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
To estimate total height I need the roofline in view, so I should tilt upward while keeping the building centered to the south.
The camera has flipped back to north again, so I need to rotate to face south (180°) to keep the target building in view for height estimation.
I should stop rotating and provide a height estimate for the main south-facing building using a typical multi-story floor height approximation from the visible facade.
